formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: Price–Yield relationship for a fixed-coupon bond: $$ P \;=\; \sum_{t=1}^{N} \frac{C}{\left(1+\frac{y}{m}\right)^{t}} \;+\; \frac{F}{\left(1+\frac{y}{m}\right)^{N}} $$ where: - P = market price (per face value F) - C = coupon per period = F \cdot \frac{c}{m} - F = face value (par) - y = nominal annual yield to maturity (unknown to solve for) - m = coupon payments per year (1, 2, or 4) - N = number of coupon periods (approximately round(years × m)) Zero-coupon special case: $$ y \;=\; m \left(\left(\frac{F}{P}\right)^{\tfrac{1}{N}} - 1\right) $$ Common approximation for YTM (starting guess): $$ \text{YTM} \;\approx\; \frac{C_\text{annual} + \frac{F - P}{T}}{\frac{F + P}{2}} $$ Effective annual yield: $$ \text{EAY} \;=\; \left(1+\frac{y}{m}\right)^m - 1 $$ Macaulay duration (in years): $$ D_\text{Mac} \;=\; \frac{1}{P}\sum_{t=1}^{N} \frac{t \cdot \text{CF}_t}{\left(1+r\right)^{t}} \cdot \frac{1}{m}, \quad r=\frac{y}{m} $$ Modified duration: $$ D_\text{Mod} \;=\; \frac{D_\text{Mac}}{1 + \frac{y}{m}} $$
